cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 265 mi (430 km) ESE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest then turning northwest, skirting just east of the northern Leeward Islands and remaining over the Atlantic well north of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall forecast through the 5-day period (expected to remain offshore of the Greater Antilles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for British Virgin Islands, St. Thomas and St. John (northern U.S. Virgin Islands), Montserrat, St. Kitts and Nevis
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Barbuda, Anguilla, Sint Maarten, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy; Tropical-storm Warning for Antigua, Saba and St. Eustatius
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands from Guadeloupe northward to Anguilla and adjacent waters
weather_observation.wind: Low (15%) chance of sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds; peak winds, if they reach the port, would likely be in the 35–45 mph range with higher gusts late Saturday into early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises and dangerous surf/rip currents possible along exposed north and east-facing beaches; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible Saturday–Sunday, insufficient for major flooding but capable of ponding on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents that could hamper small-craft and barge operations in open and exposed waters.
